column1: Hi Everyone,We are looking for some insights and safety prerequisites for our feature trip to Abu Dhabi for the upcoming IPL Series. We are in Chennai, India. We are 2 adults and comfortable living in a single room. Since the IPL Schedule is not confirmed yet by the Indian Govt but 99.9% chances are positive. Because i have seen the news all our the internet. A friend of mine forwarded this link https://t20slam.com/vivo-ipl-2020/ but i am not sure if this authentic or not. Update: The news just came in that the dates will be finalized by 1 AUG 2020. https://www.espncricinfo.com/story/_/id/2954â€¦ . Now i have to plan fast to get ealy tickets. Can you please suggest and help us with the following:1- Which hotel is best to live on affordable rates2- What Safe measures i have to follow. 3- Do i need to test for COVID and keep the report with me?4- What are some fun activities and places we can visit?Thank You
Hi. I think this year IPL will be conducted in empty stadiums because of COVID-19 threat. Better to wait a little before getting excited for your trip.

The thing that may hamper you - other than COVID impact - is Dubai is quite sporadically developed, and depending on where the fixtures are played you could lose money and time transporting about.As @turntable suggests, they could also be in empty stadiums so it's wise to see what will actually be allowed, especially for travel too.Still, it gives you plenty of time to get used to Dubai by researching the Top Questions (on the right) and back in the forums for Q4.Q3 - see the threads on testing.Q2 - see Q3 answer above.Q1 - it depends on which location. If the matches are in Sports City, that's quite some way from the main areas of Dubai (e.g. Old Dubai, Marina etc.) You can get cheap accommodation around there, especially in hotel apartments or short stay apartments that will be less than being in touristy areas, as there aren't as many hotels.
You and @turntable are right. Let's wait for another month. Thank You
